intro: Fridericia fanshawei, commonly known as the Chinese fridericia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
